intro: Wendlandia warburgii, commonly known as the Warburg's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine pubescence, while its stems are hairy and branching. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
